derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hǣth, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch heide and German Heide

entry.tran: （野草或石南丛生的）荒野，荒原
entry.def: A heath is an area of open land covered with rough grass or heather and with very few trees or bushes.

means.word_mean: 1. a low evergreen shrub of the family Ericaceae; has small bell-shaped pink or purple flowers
2. a tract of level wasteland; uncultivated land with sandy soil and scrubby vegetation
